The campus is generally very safe. I have only heard of two real incidents in the 6 years I have been living around the area. There are no call boxes for security, as at some of the bigger schools, but security does answer their phone and can be anywhere on campus pretty quickly.
There isn't a whole lot of greek life. Those that are on campus are generally talked of well, but there isn't any special privileges for them that I am aware of.

There are quite a few clubs to get involved in and campus activities to take part in. Chowan makes sure everyone has something they will like to get involved with and do a lot with the surrounding communities.
Liberal arts students do very well here. It's not big for technical or the hard sciences and there is no real computer science major. Business majors do very well here, too.

Get involved in the clubs. Virginia Beach is only about an hour and a half drive away. Busch Gardens is about two hours away. There are a lot of options if you have a car or can hitch a ride with someone.

I did not have a meal plan but ate in the cafeteria and at Murf's (the on campus little cafe type place) and the food was always good for me. It's not the best, but you can't expect a ton from college food. I liked Murf's better than the cafeteria, but the cafeteria had a lot more options.
I stayed off campus and did not live in the dorms, so I can't really comment. I do know that new apartments are being built for this fall and they look really great.

Some classes are very easy and some are notoriously hard, but overall, most classes are challenging but not overwhelming. Keep up with homework and don't be afraid to ask questions. Most professors will work with you after hours if you need help.

Make sure you get all your paperwork done early. You really want to get express check in. Check back often to insure that everything is filled and checked. Go to the earliest orientation (SOAR) possible to have a chance to get a good class schedule.

Chowan University has a great atmosphere for students. It's a small town school, which makes for a great interaction between faculty and students. The small area, however, makes social events outside of school small and not often.
